00021  *
00022  * Dynamic Locks
00023  *
00024  * struct dynlock is lockspace
00025  * one may request lock (exclusive or shared) for some value
00026  * in that lockspace
00027  *
00028  */
00029 
00030 #include <linux/module.h>
00031 #include <linux/slab.h>
00032 #include <linux/sched.h>
00033 
00034 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00035 
00036 #include <obd_support.h>
00037 #include "osd_dynlocks.h"
00038 #include "osd_internal.h"
00039 
00040 #define DYNLOCK_HANDLE_MAGIC    0xd19a10c
00041 #define DYNLOCK_HANDLE_DEAD     0xd1956ee
00042 #define DYNLOCK_LIST_MAGIC      0x11ee91e6
00043 
00044 /*
00045  * dynlock_init
00046  *
00047  * initialize lockspace
00048  *
00049  */
00050 void dynlock_init(struct dynlock *dl)
00051 {
00052         spin_lock_init(&dl->dl_list_lock);
00053         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dl->dl_list);
00054         dl->dl_magic = DYNLOCK_LIST_MAGIC;
00055 }
00056 
00057 /*
00058  * dynlock_lock
00059  *
00060  * acquires lock (exclusive or shared) in specified lockspace
00061  * each lock in lockspace is allocated separately, so user have
00062  * to specify GFP flags.
00063  * routine returns pointer to lock. this pointer is intended to
00064  * be passed to dynlock_unlock
00065  *
00066  */
00067 struct dynlock_handle *dynlock_lock(struct dynlock *dl, unsigned long value,
00068                                     enum dynlock_type lt, gfp_t gfp)
00069 {
00070         struct dynlock_handle *nhl = NULL;
00071         struct dynlock_handle *hl;
00072 
00073         BUG_ON(dl == NULL);
00074         BUG_ON(dl->dl_magic != DYNLOCK_LIST_MAGIC);
00075 
00076 repeat:
00077         /* find requested lock in lockspace */
00078         spin_lock(&dl->dl_list_lock);
00079         BUG_ON(dl->dl_list.next == NULL);
00080         BUG_ON(dl->dl_list.prev == NULL);
00081         list_for_each_entry(hl, &dl->dl_list, dh_list) {
00082                 BUG_ON(hl->dh_list.next == NULL);
00083                 BUG_ON(hl->dh_list.prev == NULL);
00084                 BUG_ON(hl->dh_magic != DYNLOCK_HANDLE_MAGIC);
00085                 if (hl->dh_value == value) {
00086                         /* lock is found */
00087                         if (nhl) {
00088                                 /* someone else just allocated
00089                                  * lock we didn't find and just created
00090                                  * so, we drop our lock
00091                                  */
00092                                 OBD_SLAB_FREE(nhl, dynlock_cachep, sizeof(*nhl));
00093                         }
00094                         hl->dh_refcount++;
00095                         goto found;
00096                 }
00097         }
00098         /* lock not found */
00099         if (nhl) {
00100                 /* we already have allocated lock. use it */
00101                 hl = nhl;
00102                 nhl = NULL;
00103                 list_add(&hl->dh_list, &dl->dl_list);
00104                 goto found;
00105         }
00106         spin_unlock(&dl->dl_list_lock);
00107 
00108         /* lock not found and we haven't allocated lock yet. allocate it */
00109         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_GFP(nhl, dynlock_cachep, sizeof(*nhl), gfp);
00110         if (nhl == NULL)
00111                 return NULL;
00112         nhl->dh_refcount = 1;
00113         nhl->dh_value = value;
00114         nhl->dh_readers = 0;
00115         nhl->dh_writers = 0;
00116         nhl->dh_magic = DYNLOCK_HANDLE_MAGIC;
00117         init_waitqueue_head(&nhl->dh_wait);
00118 
00119         /* while lock is being allocated, someone else may allocate it
00120          * and put onto to list. check this situation
00121          */
00122         goto repeat;
00123 
00124 found:
00125         if (lt == DLT_WRITE) {
00126                 /* exclusive lock: user don't want to share lock at all
00127                  * NOTE: one process may take the same lock several times
00128                  * this functionaly is useful for rename operations */
00129                 while ((hl->dh_writers && hl->dh_pid != current->pid) ||
00130                                 hl->dh_readers) {
00131                         spin_unlock(&dl->dl_list_lock);
00132                         wait_event(hl->dh_wait,
00133                                 hl->dh_writers == 0 && hl->dh_readers == 0);
00134                         spin_lock(&dl->dl_list_lock);
00135                 }
00136                 hl->dh_writers++;
00137         } else {
00138                 /* shared lock: user do not want to share lock with writer */
00139                 while (hl->dh_writers) {
00140                         spin_unlock(&dl->dl_list_lock);
00141                         wait_event(hl->dh_wait, hl->dh_writers == 0);
00142                         spin_lock(&dl->dl_list_lock);
00143                 }
00144                 hl->dh_readers++;
00145         }
00146         hl->dh_pid = current->pid;
00147         spin_unlock(&dl->dl_list_lock);
00148 
00149         return hl;
00150 }
00151 
00152 /*
00153  * dynlock_unlock
00154  *
00155  * user have to specify lockspace (dl) and pointer to lock structure
00156  * returned by dynlock_lock()
00157  *
00158  */
00159 void dynlock_unlock(struct dynlock *dl, struct dynlock_handle *hl)
00160 {
00161         int wakeup = 0;
00162 
00163         BUG_ON(dl == NULL);
00164         BUG_ON(hl == NULL);
00165         BUG_ON(dl->dl_magic != DYNLOCK_LIST_MAGIC);
00166 
00167         if (hl->dh_magic != DYNLOCK_HANDLE_MAGIC)
00168                 printk(KERN_EMERG "wrong lock magic: %#x\n", hl->dh_magic);
00169 
00170         BUG_ON(hl->dh_magic != DYNLOCK_HANDLE_MAGIC);
00171         BUG_ON(hl->dh_writers != 0 && current->pid != hl->dh_pid);
00172 
00173         spin_lock(&dl->dl_list_lock);
00174         if (hl->dh_writers) {
00175                 BUG_ON(hl->dh_readers != 0);
00176                 hl->dh_writers--;
00177                 if (hl->dh_writers == 0)
00178                         wakeup = 1;
00179         } else if (hl->dh_readers) {
00180                 hl->dh_readers--;
00181                 if (hl->dh_readers == 0)
00182                         wakeup = 1;
00183         } else {
00184                 BUG();
00185         }
00186         if (wakeup) {
00187                 hl->dh_pid = 0;
00188                 wake_up(&hl->dh_wait);
00189         }
00190         if (--(hl->dh_refcount) == 0) {
00191                 hl->dh_magic = DYNLOCK_HANDLE_DEAD;
00192                 list_del(&hl->dh_list);
00193                 OBD_SLAB_FREE(hl, dynlock_cachep, sizeof(*hl));
00194         }
00195         spin_unlock(&dl->dl_list_lock);
00196 }
00197 
00198 int dynlock_is_locked(struct dynlock *dl, unsigned long value)
00199 {
00200         struct dynlock_handle *hl;
00201         int result = 0;
00202 
00203         /* find requested lock in lockspace */
00204         spin_lock(&dl->dl_list_lock);
00205         BUG_ON(dl->dl_list.next == NULL);
00206         BUG_ON(dl->dl_list.prev == NULL);
00207         list_for_each_entry(hl, &dl->dl_list, dh_list) {
00208                 BUG_ON(hl->dh_list.next == NULL);
00209                 BUG_ON(hl->dh_list.prev == NULL);
00210                 BUG_ON(hl->dh_magic != DYNLOCK_HANDLE_MAGIC);
00211                 if (hl->dh_value == value && hl->dh_pid == current->pid) {
00212                         /* lock is found */
00213                         result = 1;
00214                         break;
00215                 }
00216         }
00217         spin_unlock(&dl->dl_list_lock);
00218         return result;
00219 }
